item.title: Report X-2024121251
item.description:
Report X-2024121251

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/18/2024, at approximately 1400 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 19 fiberboard boxes, each presumably containing 4 glass bottles. One of boxes appeared to have been damaged, showing wet spots on the outer packaging. Further investigation revealed that 2 of the 4 bottles in the package were broken, resulting in spillage. The cause is the damage is unknown. The remaining 18 packages were moved forward in transit and the damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and hazardous disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024121254
item.description:
Report X-2024121254

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found a the MEMH location. It contained four glass bottles with egg crates top and bottom one bottle was broken spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024121253
item.description:
Report X-2024121253

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a forklift struck an overpack shipment on a wooden skid. The fork damaged one of the fiberboard boxes on the wooden skid causing a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings and fiberboard dividers. The release affected three other fiberboard boxes on the wooden skid. All contents were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024120462
item.description:
Report E-2024120462

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: GOODLETTSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:33 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (NGO) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper packaging, approximately 1 cup of VertecBio Clean ECO-Solv (hazardous - UN1993) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged drum, and oil-dri will be placed into an 80-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024120458
item.description:
Report E-2024120458

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0412 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BNA. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of Teal Epoxy was released from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a pinhole forklift puncture. The release impacted the concrete at the dock. No absorbents were needed. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The drum was containerized to (1) 65-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024120255
item.description:
Report E-2024120255

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately 35-gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent, absorbents, and hand tools to clear all product from the site. All impacted materials were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two glass bottles with Styrofoam packing peanuts. One of the glass bottle broke spilling the contents. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024121187
item.description:
Report X-2024121187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-26T21:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-07
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 12/06/2024 at approximately 2230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a hazardous material spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing two smaller boxes, each with 12 aerosol cans inside. Two one cans in one inner package accidentally discharged, resulting in spillage. The cause of the discharge is unknown. The discharged canisters were discarded, and the remainder of the shipment was placed in a salvage drum, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
